title: Srđan Stanić (footballer, born 1989)
text:
Srđan Stanić (; born 6 July 1989) is a Bosnian professional <a href="Football%20player">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Full-back">full-back</a> for <a href="First%20League%20of%20the%20Federation%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">First League of FBiH</a> club <a href="FK%20Igman%20Konjic">Igman Konjic</a>.
He is well known for winning the Goal of the week video poll on Goal.com ahead of other big names like <a href="Zlatan%20Ibrahimovi%C4%87">Zlatan Ibrahimović</a> and <a href="Ra%C3%BAl%20%28footballer%29">Raul</a> for his 35-meter goal against <a href="FK%20Rudar%20Prijedor">Rudar Prijedor</a> while a part of <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeljezni%C4%8Dar%20Sarajevo">Željezničar</a>.
Club career.
Early career.
Stanić started off his professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> career at <a href="FK%20Sarajevo">Sarajevo</a>, before joining the youth team of <a href="FK%20Slavija%20Sarajevo">Slavija Sarajevo</a> in 2005. He made his debut for the first team in 2006. In 2007, he left Slavija. 
Željezničar.
Shortly after leaving Slavija, in the summer of 2007, Stanić joined <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeljezni%C4%8Dar%20Sarajevo">Željezničar</a>. While at Željezničar, he won 3 <a href="Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnian Championships</a> and 2 <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20Football%20Cup">Bosnian Cups</a>, and was also one of the best players of the club at the time. He was also the club <a href="Captain%20%28association%20football%29">captain</a> in 2014.
He left Željezničar in June 2015, 8 years after joining the club.
Olimpik.
In mid-2015, Stanić signed with <a href="FK%20Olimpik">Olimpik</a> as a <a href="free%20agent">free agent</a>. In January 2016, he left Olimpik.
Return to Željezničar.
On 27 January 2016, Stanić came back to Željezničar and signed a 2 year contract. In July 2016, after <a href="Milo%C5%A1%20Kosti%C4%87">Miloš Kostić</a> became the new manager of Željezničar, Stanić was left out of the first team and leaving the club felt like an option, but after <a href="Slavko%20Petrovi%C4%87">Slavko Petrović</a> was named the new manager of the club, the first thing he did was getting Stanić back in to the first team and thus, Stanić stayed at Željezničar.
After almost 2 years in his second stint with Željezničar, he left the club on 29 December 2017.
Zrinjski Mostar.
On 5 January 2018, Stanić joined <a href="H%C5%A0K%20Zrinjski%20Mostar">Zrinjski Mostar</a> on a 2 and a half year contract, which was due to keep him at the club until the summer of 2020. On 21 December 2018, Stanić left the club after not having enough playing time.
With Zrinjski, he won the <a href="Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnian Premier League</a> title in the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">2017–18</a> season.
Second return to Željezničar.
On 31 January 2019, Stanić, for a second time came back and signed a contract with Željezničar, which was due to keep him at the club until the summer of 2020. He made his third debut for Željezničar in a 1–0 home win against <a href="FK%20Zvijezda%2009">Zvijezda 09</a> on 17 March 2019, playing the whole 90 minutes of the match. He left the club after his contract expired in August 2020.
Igman Konjic.
On 26 September 2020, Stanić signed a contract with <a href="First%20League%20of%20the%20Federation%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">First League of FBiH</a> club <a href="FK%20Igman%20Konjic">Igman Konjic</a>. He made his debut only four days later, on 30 September, in a cup match against Velež Nevesinje.
International career.
Stanić was part of the <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Bosnia and Herzegovina U19 national team</a>. On 16 December 2011, he made an appearance for the <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20football%20team">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> first team in a 1–0 <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly game</a> loss against <a href="Poland%20national%20football%20team">Poland</a>.
On 13 May 2014, Stanić was included in the <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20football%20team">Bosnian national team</a> provisional <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a> squad by head coach <a href="Safet%20Su%C5%A1i%C4%87">Safet Sušić</a>, but did not make the final team.
Style of play.
Stanić is a long-time versatile player who can play anywhere in midfield, notably on the <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">wings</a>. He has featured as a wing-back on several occasions.
Honours.
Željezničar 
Zrinjski Mostar
